faqs.question: La Costa Blanca est-elle un bon endroit pour acheter un bien immobilier ?
faqs.answer: Yes, Costa Blanca demonstrates +8% year-on-year capital appreciation with established infrastructure, reliable rental demand, and mature international communities. The region balances affordability with European legal certainty, making it strategically superior to emerging market alternatives.

faqs.question: Les étrangers peuvent-ils acheter un bien immobilier en Espagne ?
faqs.answer: Yes, non-EU and EU citizens possess identical property purchase rights in Spain. Foreign buyers require Spanish tax identification (NIF) but face no ownership restrictions. Legal frameworks treat all buyers equally, protecting property rights through EU law.

faqs.question: Quels sont les frais d'achat d'un bien immobilier en Espagne ?
faqs.answer: Purchase costs typically total 8-10% of property value, including 6-7% transfer tax (ITP), legal fees (€800-1,200), notary fees (€300-500), and property registration. Ongoing costs include annual property tax (0.4-1.1% value), community fees (€100-300/month typical), and optional insurance.

faqs.question: Combien coûtent les taxes foncières en Espagne ?
faqs.answer: Annual property tax (Impuesto sobre Bienes Inmuebles) ranges 0.4-1.1% of official property value, varying by municipality. Alicante typically applies 0.7% rates. For this €319,900 property, annual property tax approximately €2,200-3,500. Non-resident capital gains tax applies on property sale at 19-21% for EU residents.

faqs.question: Puis-je obtenir un prêt hypothécaire en Espagne en tant qu'étranger ?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreign property investors access Spanish mortgages through major banks (Santander, BBVA, CaixaBank). Typical terms offer 70-80% LTV at 2.5-3.5% interest rates. Documentation requirements include proof of income, tax returns, and EU identification. Mortgage application processes typically require 3-4 weeks.

faqs.question: Quel est le coût de la vie sur la Costa Blanca ?
faqs.answer: Monthly costs for couples average €1,500-2,200 including utilities, food, transport, and entertainment—approximately 35-40% less than equivalent UK expenses. Healthcare costs prove minimal for EU residents (public system), while private healthcare remains affordable. Rental property management services charge 15-20% of gross rental income.

faqs.question: Quel temps fait-il sur la Costa Blanca ?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys 320 days of annual sunshine with Mediterranean climate. Winter temperatures average 12-15°C (rarely below 5°C), while summer temperatures reach 26-28°C. Rainfall concentrates in autumn/winter (December-March), while summer remains dry and stable—ideal for reliable holiday rental seasons.

faqs.question: What rental income can I expect from a holiday let in Alicante?
faqs.answer: Typical weekly rates for 2-bedroom apartments average €800-900 during peak seasons (July-August, Easter, Christmas holidays). Realistic annual occupancy achieves 60-70% yield, generating €25,000-29,000 gross annual income (representing 7.8-9.1% gross yield on €319,900 purchase price). Professional management services charge 15-20% of rental income.

faqs.question: How far is Alicante from the UK?
